task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the small plate, then grasp the spatula tool and push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows a pot with a lid, a small round plate, a spatula-like tool, and a bowl on a two-tone surface. The robot must first take the lid off the pot, then relocate the pot onto the plate, and finally use the spatula to push the pot toward the front (operator) edge of the table. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception, stable grasps, gentle placement onto the plate, and a planar push with the tool toward a specific direction.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula are on the table and reachable.
Robot gripper is functional and empty at start.
Workspace is free of unexpected obstacles near the motion paths.
stepwise_plan: Perceive pot and plate; open the pot by removing its lid.
Approach and grasp the pot securely, lift slightly.
Place the pot onto the plate and release.
Perceive and grasp the spatula tool.
Push the pot toward the front edge of the table using the spatula.
success_criteria: Lid is no longer covering the pot.
Pot is resting on the plate with visible contact.
Pot has been pushed toward the front edge as intended.
failure_and_recovery: If grasp is unstable, retry alignment and close gripper again.
If placement misaligns, re-approach and re-place.
If push stalls, re-approach pot with tool and repeat push with same direction.
task_long_description.termination: End when the push is completed and the robot has released the tool and retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear alignment above the pot/plate region with contact forming.
frame_3.predicts_next: Placement or pushing actuation is imminent; confirms task directionality.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Open/remove the lid from the pot.
Approach the pot and align for grasp.
Close gripper to grasp the pot.
Place pot onto the plate pose.
Release the pot on the plate.
Perceive and localize the spatula tool.
Approach the spatula to grasp it.
Push the pot toward the front (180°) using the spatula.

failure_modes: Lid not removed due to mis-detection or jam.
Pot misaligned with plate causing unstable placement.
Push direction incorrect or insufficient distance.
recovery_strategy: Re-detect objects and re-approach if alignment fails.
If grasp unstable, reopen and re-close gripper then retry alignment.
After poor placement, re-approach and re-place with same pose key.
If push insufficient, re-approach pot with tool and repeat push.
assumptions: Frames appear consistent with pot, plate, and spatula; exact lid motion is inferred and modeled via OpenContainer.
Front of table corresponds to direction 180° in the scene frame.
Plate is stable and sized to hold the pot without additional constraints.

expected_success_criteria: Post-condition shows pot on plate without lid.
Pot centroid moved toward table front after tool push.
